label: 顕密
本: Alms and Vagabonds: Buddhist Temples and Popular Patronage in Medieval Japan . University of Hawai'i Press . 1994
説明文: The term was applied to the established schools of Buddhism in the Heian and Kamakura periods. The kenmitsu schools included the traditional six schools of Nara, established prior to the Heian period, and the Heian schools of Tendai and Shingon. [天台、真言]
